miscellaneous

myutils.miscellaneous.output_terminal(cmd, print_output=False, **kwargs)[source]

Runs a command in a terminal and save the output in a list of strings

Parameters:

cmd (str) – bash command to be executed in the terminal.

Return type:

out = list[str] output of the executed command.

myutils.miscellaneous._time(keyword, logfile)[source]
myutils.miscellaneous.time_g09(logfile)[source]

Function that extracts the time spend for one gaussian simulation from a .log file.

Parameters:

logfile (string) – .log file obtained during a gaussian simulation.

Returns:

  • Time in seconds although the time in minutes, seconds and hours are

  • printed.

myutils.miscellaneous.format_to_pdb(name_input, name_output=None)[source]

This function takes the last configuration of one file (e.g. one gaussian *.log file) and saves the last configuration in a pdb file.

Parameters:

  • name_input (string) – Name of files to be modified (e.g. ‘./*.log’ ).

  • name_output (string) – Output name. Default: same name as input but with pdb extension.

Return type:

List of output names of pdb files.

myutils.miscellaneous.optimized_e(file)[source]

This code finds the last energy in a log file of gaussian computed using RBMK functional. The output is given in eV.

Parameters:

file (str) – log gaussian file.

Return type:

Potential energy in eV units.

myutils.miscellaneous.min_profile_from_several(files, num_ranges=20)[source]

This function returns the profile of minimum potential energy respect to one variable.

Parameters:

  • files (list of strings) – files that contain the data.

  • indexes (list of ints) – indexes of the columns that contains the data of variable, energy and time. Default indexes are 3, 2, 0 that corresponds to the distance variable, pot energy and time in the file analysis_merged_table.dat

  • num_ranges (int) – number of blocks to divide the variable range. Default 20

  • Note (The idea of this function is to split the variable in ranges and to) –

  • range. (take the minimum energy in each) –

Return type:

Duple with de data time, variable, energy
